intro: Patellaria webbiana, commonly known as the mountain buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy, often toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with five petals and a hairy, rough stem. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
